TravelTriangle > Blog > Resorts > 10 Best Hotels And Resorts In Shillong That Will Entice You To Explore Meghalaya! 10 Best Hotels And Resorts In Shillong That Will Entice You To Explore Meghalaya! .. SHARES Updated Date: 19 April 2023 With its stunning waterfalls, mystical cloud cover, and picturesque mountains, the word ‘Shillong’ literally translates to “The Abode of Clouds”. The kaleidoscope of beauty in Meghalaya is complimented by these hotels and resorts in Shillong that further enhance the vacation experience to something unforgettable. The Northeast is a region that has finally started to catch the eye of travelers looking to head out for a new and authentic vacation experience. Shillong, a city in the seven sisters states, benefits from being located in a remote corner of India. Travelers get a bonus of visiting a lush-green hill station and, at the same time, staying in some of the best hotels and resorts in Shillong that make up for an important part of a memorable vacation in Meghalaya. Table Of Content Hotels and resorts in Shillong that offer an authentic Khasi experience 1. Blueberry Inn There are a few things that make Blueberry Inn so popular amongst travelers who regularly visit Meghalaya and often need to search for hotels and resorts in Shillong. The hotel offers exceptional service with delicious food, coupled with the fact that it is merely a kilometer from the city center. Address: Rita Road, Opp Wards Lake, ShillongRoom price: INR 3,500 per nightTripAdvisor rating: 4.5/5 Website | Reviews Suggested Read: 13 Gorgeous Homestays In North East India That’ll Transport You To Another World Sikkim-Gangtok-Darjeeling Holiday Packages On TravelTriangle Visit Sikkim and explore Yumthang valley, Tsomgo Lake, Gangtok, Nathula Pass, and Pelling. Experience peace and tranquility while exploring Buddhist monasteries, snow-capped mountains, and wildlife sanctuaries. Royal Heritage- Tripura Castle Known for its classy interiors and old-world charm, Royal Heritage- Tripura Castle is like a vintage wine that keeps getting better as it gets older. The hotel has a lot of history attached to go with it, as the resort still serves as a home for the royal family of Tripura. With wooden furnishing and modern facilities within the resort, Royal Heritage is an enticing entry into the hotels and resorts in Shillong. Address: Cleve Colony, Tripura Castle Road, ShillongRoom price: INR 4,700 per nightTripAdvisor rating: 4/5 Website | Reviews 3. Cafe Shillong Bed and Breakfast Many hotels and resorts in Shillong have often swayed away from going into the BnB category due to its unexpected demand and low traveler turn up. However, Cafe Shillong Bed and Breakfast has maintained its excellent reputation thanks to the high-class service, dedicated hospitality, and concentration on their niche segment. Address: 31, Lower Lachumiere, ShillongRoom price: INR 3,800 per nightTripAdvisor rating: 4.5/5 Website | Reviews Suggested Read: North East Trip: Exploring The Soul-Stirring States Of Seven Sisters, One Brother, And A Neighbor In India! 4. Roseville Resort Shillong Many small hotels and resorts in Shillong offer an option of homestays, but not many do it better than Roseville. An 80-year-old resort that initially began as a hill retreat for the Britishers, has now become a pillar of constant in the sea of change Shillong has been through since its existence. Address: Upper Nongthymmai, ShillongRoom price: INR 2,300 per nightTripAdvisor rating: 3.5/5 Website | Reviews 5. Ri Kynjai- Serenity by the Lake Ri Kynjai translates to “Serenity by the lake”, and this resort has done a commendable job in keeping up with its name. The best out of all the luxury resorts in Shillong for families and high-end travelers, Ri Kynjai leaves no stones unturned in making sure that its visitors get an authentic Khasi accommodation wrapped in luxury and comfort. If travelers are looking for best hotels and resorts in Shillong with a pristine lake view, then Ri Kynjai should be on top of their list. Address: Umniah Khwan, UCC Road, Ri Bhoi DistrictRoom price: INR 11,500 per nightTripAdvisor rating: 4.5/5 Website | Reviews Suggested Read: 15 Captivating Honeymoon Destinations In North East India 6. Hotel Center Point As the name suggests, Hotel Center Point is one of the most easily accessible hotels and resorts in Shillong. Located in the Police Bazar area, this unique looking hotel has supporting staff, and very understanding managers to handle all the specific demands of its visitors. Address: Khyndailad, Police Bazar, ShillongRoom price: INR 6,100 per nightTripAdvisor rating: 4/5 Reviews Suggested Read: 43 Must Visit Places When Travelling to the North East 7. Hotel Polo Towers A hotel chain that comes with an established and recognized experience is hospitality, Hotel Polo Towers is one of the first 4 star hotels to be opened in Shillong. One of the very few hotels and resorts in Shillong that not only give an exemplary output in hospitality but also operated two very successful cafes in Shillong- Dylan Cafe and ML 05 Cafe. Address: Oakland Road, Near Polo Grounds, ShillongRoom price: INR 4,400 per nightTripAdvisor rating: 3.5/5 Website | Reviews 8. Quinton Enclave Budget travelers looking for hotels and resorts in Shillong with a homely experience should definitely consider this cozy guesthouse. As it is located inside a residential complex, guests can expect a comfortable and quiet stay away from the hustle and bustle of Shillong. However, it is important to note that this guesthouse does not accept guests unannounced. A prior booking or a correspondence on mail is recommended. Address: Quinton Road, ShillongRoom price: INR 3,400 per nightTripAdvisor rating: 4.5/5 Website | Reviews Suggested Read: 15 Secrets Of North East India Locals Have Been Keeping To Themselves 9. The Eee Cee Hotel For travelers who like to stick to the simple basics like a clean room, good food, and friendly staff then The Eee Cee Hotel is one of the best hotels and resorts in Shillong to stay in. The hotel has a 60-year experience in hospitality and getting the basics of hotel management spot on. With ATMs nearby, main market at a walking distance, good restaurants just a stone’s throw away, and knowledgeable staff, the travelers definitely get a good value out of what they are paying for a stay at the Eee Cee Hotel. Address: Khyndailad, Jail Road, Police Bazar, ShillongRoom price: INR 2,500TripAdvisor rating: 4/5 Website | Reviews 10. The Habitat Shillong (Asian Confluence) Having designed themselves as a retreat for corporates and businesses, The Habitat specializes in a variety of things ranging from fully furnished accommodation, world-class business conference halls, and professional staff that are very helpful and cordial. Travelers who are looking for hotels and resorts in Shillong that offer a short, comfortable and luxurious stay should consider The Habitat, Shillong. Address: Lady Veronica Ln, Laitumkhrah, ShillongRoom price: INR 3,300TripAdvisor rating: 4.5/5 Website | Reviews Suggested Read: The Ever Growing Living Root Bridges, Meghalaya – A Nature’s Marvel In The Northeast With a plethora of options to choose from, hotels and resorts in Shillong are surely up to the task of matching the standard of serenity, and beauty set by the hills of Meghalaya that surround Shillong. Frequently Asked Questions About Hotels Ans Resorts In Shillong Is Shillong worth visiting? Shillong is a beautiful hill station located at an altitude of 4,908 feet surrounded by picturesque views of peaky mountain ranges and pristine nature making it a place well worth visiting. What is the best time to visit Shillong? The months between September to May is the most ideal time to visit Shillong. The cool and dry weather makes it quite pleasant for exploring the beautiful landscapes of this astounding hill station. Which are the best places to visit in Shillong? Some of the most amazing places to visit in Shillong are: 1. Elephant Falls 2. Umiam Lake 3. Shillong Peak 4. Mawphlang Sacred Forest 5. Rhino Heritage Museum How can I go to Shillong from Guwahati? If you are traveling to Shillong from Guwahati, the best route would be by road. There are not direct railway routes, bus routes or train routes connecting these places. The only option that you would be left with is traveling by a shared car or by your private car. How far is Cherrapunji from Shillong? Cherrapunji is nearly 54km away from Shillong and can be reached in 2 hours if traveling via SH 5. Is Shillong safe? Yes, Shillong is absolutely safe for all kinds of tourists. However, make sure you do not go wandering about in extremely remote areas all alone as the jungles of hilly regions can be a bit unpredictable. How many days are enough for Shillong? If you do not have a lot of time at hand, you can explore the most popular tourist places within 3-4 days but in order to see the best of Shillong, you will need at least 7-9 days. Does it snow in Shillong? No. Shillong does not recieve nay snowfall, however, the temperature during winters can be pretty cold especially in the high altitude regions.
